channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: EasyJet ups dividend on surging profits from ‘record breaking’ summer
Volkswagen to sell controversial factory in China’s Xinjiang
The new ‘land grab’ for AI companies, from Meta to OpenAI, is military contracts
item.description: Silicon Valley generative AI companies are getting over their aversion to working with the U.S. Department of Defense, as the pressure builds to get r...

item.title: Here’s how HP’s CEO says the company is thinking about possible tariffs
Here’s how much prices of Modelo and Corona beer may rise to cover tariffs
Want to cut government waste? Start with the penny says U.S. Senator to Musk
item.description: Countries like Canada and Australia have stopped producing one-cent coins for more than a decade. Sweden was a first mover in 1972.

item.title: Sanofi CEO Paul Hudson takes inspiration from ‘Fight Club’ to get his team hooked on AI
item.description: Hudson says many CEOs are scared of AI, comparing it to The Terminator’s John Connor traveling back in time to stop the rise of the machines.

item.title: Even if you think education is a local issue, STEM is key to national security
item.description: Across the board, American K-12 students struggle to meet math and reading proficiency standards.

item.title: DeMark says his models are flagging major caution for the U.S. holiday week
Vauxhall workers face 140-mile relocation or losing their jobs as Stellantis plans to shutter 120-year-old factory
item.description: More than 1,000 Vauxhall workers will need to move from Luton to Cheshire to keep their jobs as Stellantis consolidates EV manufacturing.
